habitat: Deciduous woodlands on clay or chalky soils, parklands, fairy rings, late summer to autumn, Europe, North America.
shortDescription: Poisonous mushroom with ivory to light gray-brown cap, sinuate gills turning pink, thick whitish stem, causes gastrointestinal problems.
benefitsOrToxicity: Causes gastrointestinal problems like diarrhea, vomiting, headache 30 min to 2 hours, lasts up to 48 hours, rarely delirium, depression, possibly fatal.

identification.cap: Ivory white darkening with age, conical to convex to plane with blunt umbo, slightly sticky, margin rolled inward, 6-20 cm.
identification.gills: Yellowish white initially, sinuate, crowded, turn pinkish with spores.
identification.stem: Ivory white, smooth, cylindrical sometimes bulbous base, 3-10 cm long, 0.6-1.5 cm diameter, no ring.
identification.microscopicFeatures: Spores subglobose, angular, 7-10 x 7-9 µm, prominent germ pore.

note: Responsible for many poisonings in Europe, type species of Entoloma, accumulates heavy metals.
